adr_address: 5 Rue de Berri, 75008 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Warm rooms & suites with free Wi-Fi, plus a fine-dining restaurant & a chic cocktail bar.

name: Warwick Champs-Elysées Paris

reviews.text: It was a fine staying but it is absolutely overpriced. Breakfast and staff were good. Location is good and if you have a terrace it is Eiffel view. The building is old, cleaning was so so.

I stayed at this hotel for its perfect location near the Champs-Élysées, which is definitely a highlight. The staff were friendly and welcoming, making check-in smooth and pleasant.

Unfortunately, the room itself was disappointing. It had a strong humidity smell and felt very old and poorly maintained. The atmosphere in the room made my stay uncomfortable, and I expected a higher standard given the area.

Overall, while the location and staff are great, the room conditions need serious improvement. I wouldn’t return unless renovations are made.

Had a great stay at this hotel. The rooms clean and the location is perfect if you’re looking for a hotel few steps away from champs Elyse. Or almost in champs elyse because you literally wall for a less than a minute! The only thing that was off is that we waited 3 hours to check in in our room which was annoying because their lobby is very small and we were tired we just wanted to get into our room and rest.

The location of the hotel is undeniably excellent – just steps from the Champs-Elysées, making it ideal for exploring central Paris. Unfortunately, that’s where the positives mostly end.

The hotel itself feels extremely dated and in dire need of a full renovation. The interior is dark, heavy, and has not aged well – it truly looks and feels like it’s stuck in the 1970s. The dark red carpets and furnishings give a worn, almost dirty impression. It’s not just about aesthetics – there’s a general feeling of neglect.

My room (420) was of a decent size, which is a plus for Paris, but cleanliness left much to be desired. I found garbage from previous guests upon check-in, which is unacceptable. The minibar prices were also shockingly inflated – €8 for a small Toblerone, which you can find just a minute away at Carrefour for around €1.30.

Breakfast was by far the worst part of the stay. I gave it a try on the first morning and never returned. There were very few options, poor quality food, and no available tables. The atmosphere was uncomfortable, and the staff appeared uninterested and disengaged.

On a slightly better note, the ladies at the reception were polite and did their job adequately, but the internet connection was unreliable, which added to the overall frustration.

This hotel might have once been something special, but now it relies solely on its location and charges premium prices for subpar service and outdated facilities. I would not recommend staying here until major renovations and service improvements are made.

There are many hotels in Paris lacking customer service, including 5 STAR HOTELS…but there are a few where the customer service is beyond Royal. The Warwick Hotel Champs Elysees is at the Top of the List for Phenomenol Service. When we walked in, we were met by a sweet kind caring woman who sat us in the lobby and graciously brought over 2 glasses of water with lemon wedges, smiled and treated us like guests in her home. Her energy was sweet and caring and we were surprised by how welcoming she was. The AMAZING part was… she was the Director of the entire hotel, the leader who leads by example and sets the tone and mood of the entire property. We stay at the finest hotels in the world and have never been met and cared for by the Director of any hotel in 40 years. Yes, Annabelle, the Warwick Director is the only Professional leader in the hospitality business to show such Grace, Respect and kindness. She was at the front desk, walking the hotel checking on guests and helping fellow employees. She inspires her staff, respects her staff and most importantly … interacts with guest when most directors hide in their offices like they are above others and too important to actually work. Her staff like, respect and adore their Leader and mirror her kindness and Professionalism. Everyone at the front desk, bell desk, security, bars, restaurants, housekeeping and room service were beyond beyond sweet. Brennen, in guest relations called us several times asking if we needed anything, Franklin in room service, greeted us with a huge smile, set up our breakfast and poured our coffee and said “ anything you need please call and I’ll be here in just moments”. He even took some boxes and bags from the room after our shopping…we we so impressed by his sweet nature… we tipped him 50€ on a 50€ breakfast bill. We love Annabelle, Franklin, Brennen and the whole staff. Thank you Annabelle, for making our trip unbelievable, for treating us like Royalty and uplifting our trip, you should teach Directors around the world how to lead, how to show kindness and grace… you’re a STAR and Warwick Hotels and Resorts are Blessed to have you and you’re  Blessed because Warwick Hotels is a Phenomenal Hotel Group who cares about their staff and customers. ❤️🙏😇
